ratings.comment: Sweetest woman I have ever met. Lectures are mandatory for participation credit, but she allows a few skips like most professors. Extra credit on the exams also allow lenience for attendance. Definitely recommend not skipping because she is an amazing lecturer. Material isn't hard but it really gets you thinking about yourself and the world around

Katie is absolutely amazing as a teacher. Although her class wasn't very hard, I learned so much more about the world and myself from her and her class than any other class I have taken. She truly cares about her students, and makes the classroom an inviting and fun space that you actually want to be in.

Katie was such a great professor! Her lectures were interesting and kept the class engaged. She was a very easy grader. All tests were open book and taken outside of class. She offered multiple extra credit opportunities and was a very understanding professor. Overall one of my favorite professors on campus!
Claims lectures are mandatory but you can skip 10 of them and still get over a 100% on the class so easily with all the extra credit opportunities
Was a great class to take. Katie was very accommodating to conflicts and issues that came up throughout the semester.

Sweetest woman ever. Her lectures are not required and many many many students skip it. She is a great lecturer and I found myself enjoying each lecture and skipping as few as possible. There is a lot of extra credit offered and no final exam. Midterms are online and open note. Easiest A ever. Would take over and over again!
Lectures are not mandatory, but she makes them FUN, more importantly FUNNY, and not to mention- interesting! I wish she taught more classes at UW!
She's literally the best teacher I've ever had. She has a very small workload, but it helps you learn and process the information so much better. No exams are a plus!
Favorite teacher when I went to Madison. Would recommend to anyone pursuing a career in Business, Science, or even Language arts. If I saw her today., I would cry tears of happiness.
